com.salesforce.omakase.ast.atrule

Class AtRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.salesforce.omakase.ast.AbstractSyntax
      • com.salesforce.omakase.ast.collection.AbstractGroupable<StatementIterable,Statement>
        • com.salesforce.omakase.ast.atrule.AtRule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Groupable<StatementIterable,Statement>, Named, Refinable, Statement, Syntax, Broadcastable, Writable

    public final class AtRule
extends AbstractGroupable<StatementIterable,Statement>
implements Statement, Refinable, Named
    Represents one of the CSS at-rules, such as @media, @charset, @keyframes, etc...

    See the notes on Refinable.

    See Also:
    AtRuleParser

    • Constructor Summary

      Creates a new instance with no line or column specified (used for dynamically created Syntax units).

    • Constructor Detail

      • AtRule

        public AtRule(int line,
              int column,
              String name,
              RawSyntax rawExpression,
              RawSyntax rawBlock)
        Constructs a new AtRule instance.
        Parameters:
        line - The line number.
        column - The column number.
        name - Name of the at-rule.
        rawExpression - The raw at-rule expression. If no expression is present pass in null.
        rawBlock - The raw at-rule block. If no block is present pass in null.

      • AtRule

        public AtRule(String name,
              AtRuleExpression expression,
              AtRuleBlock block)
        Creates a new instance with no line or column specified (used for dynamically created Syntax units).
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the at-rule.
        expression - The at-rule's expression, or null if not present.
        block - The at-rule's block, or null if not present.

      • shouldWriteName

        public AtRule shouldWriteName(boolean shouldWriteName)
        Specifies whether the name should be written out. This might be specified as false by custom refiners where the name of the custom at-rule is not applicable in the final CSS source.
        Parameters:
        shouldWriteName - Whether the at-rule name (and @ symbol) should be written out.
        Returns:
        this, for chaining.
        See Also:
        markAsMetadataRule()

      • shouldWriteName

        public boolean shouldWriteName()
        Gets whether the name of the atRule should be written out. Default is true, but can be modified via shouldWriteName(boolean).
        Returns:
        True if the name of the atRule should be written out.

      • rawExpression

        public Optional<RawSyntax> rawExpression()
        Gets the original, raw, non-validated expression if present (e.g., "utf-8", or "all and (min-width: 800px)".
        Returns:
        The raw expression, or an empty Optional if not present.

      • rawBlock

        public Optional<RawSyntax> rawBlock()
        Gets the original, raw, non-validated at-rule block, if present.
        Returns:

      • expression

        public Optional<AtRuleExpression> expression()
        Gets the at-rule expression, if present.

        Important: this may be Optional.empty() if this at-rule is unrefined.

        Returns:
        The expression, or an empty Optional if not present.

      • block

        public Optional<AtRuleBlock> block()
        Gets the at-rule block, if present.

        Returns:
        The block, or an empty Optional if not present.

      • markAsMetadataRule

        public AtRule markAsMetadataRule()
        Used to indicate this at-rule is for metadata purposes only and should not be written out in the output CSS.

        This is mainly used for custom syntax.

        Returns:
        this, for chaining.

      • isConditional

        public boolean isConditional()
        Determines if this rule is conditional (@if) or not.

        For more information on conditional at rules, see ConditionalAtRuleBlock.

        Returns:
        True if this rule is conditional, else false. This class defaults to false if not explicitly set.
        See Also:
        setConditional(boolean)

      • shouldBreakBroadcast

        public boolean shouldBreakBroadcast(SubscriptionPhase phase)
        Description copied from interface: Broadcastable
        Gets whether an in-progress broadcast should be stopped.

        This might be true if a change of state or conditions of the unit result in the broadcast no longer being necessary during the given SubscriptionPhase.

        Specified by:
        shouldBreakBroadcast in interface Broadcastable
        Overrides:
        shouldBreakBroadcast in class AbstractSyntax
        Parameters:
        phase - The current SubscriptionPhase.
        Returns:
        True if in-progress broadcasting should be stopped.

      • propagateBroadcast

        public void propagateBroadcast(Broadcaster broadcaster,
                               Status status)
        Description copied from interface: Broadcastable
        Broadcasts or rebroadcasts all child units using the given Broadcaster.

        The broadcast will only occur for a unit if its Status matches the given Status.

        Implementers should call this on child units and SyntaxCollections first, then use the broadcaster to broadcast itself. All of this should be wrapped in a check to ensure the Status matches.

        Specified by:
        propagateBroadcast in interface Broadcastable
        Overrides:
        propagateBroadcast in class AbstractSyntax
        Parameters:
        broadcaster - Use this Broadcaster to broadcast all unbroadcasted child units.
        status - Broadcast units that have this status.

      • isWritable

        public boolean isWritable()
        Description copied from interface: Writable
        Returns whether this unit should actually be written.

        Usually this should just return true, however some units that are detachable or otherwise potentially invalid should first check their state and respond appropriately.

        Specified by:
        isWritable in interface Writable
        Overrides:
        isWritable in class AbstractGroupable<StatementIterable,Statement>
        Returns:
        True if the unit should be written.

      • write

        public void write(StyleWriter writer,
                  StyleAppendable appendable)
           throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: Writable
        Outputs this Writable's string representation.

        Important notes for implementation:

        Do not use the StyleWriter in an attempt to write direct content (Strings, chars, etc...). Use the StyleAppendable.

        The StyleWriter should be used to make decisions based on writer settings (e.g., compressed vs. verbose output mode), as well as for writing inner or child Writables. Do not call the this method method directly on inner or child Writables! That would bypass any overrides that are set on the StyleWriter. Use StyleWriter.writeInner(Writable, StyleAppendable) instead.

        Specified by:
        write in interface Writable
        Parameters:
        writer - Writer to use for output settings and for writing inner Writables.
        appendable - Append direct content to this StyleAppendable.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

        Description copied from class: AbstractSyntax

        Specified by:

        Specified by:

        Specified by:

        Returns:
